title: Geography
Description: The article discusses the geological processes that created India, including the movement of tectonic plates that formed the Indian Ocean and led to the uplift of the Himalayas. The article also describes the different geographical features of India, including peninsular India, the Indo-Gangetic Plain, and the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The article notes the importance of India's rivers and the impact of climate change on the country's temperatures and weather patterns.
